dt: {bc}to connect by means of an interface

shortdef: to connect by means of an interface
to serve as an interface for

dt: {bc}the place at which independent and often unrelated systems meet and act on or communicate with each other
{bc}the means by which {a_link|interaction} or communication is achieved at an interface
{bc}a surface forming a common boundary of two bodies, spaces, or phases

shortdef: the place at which independent and often unrelated systems meet and act on or communicate with each other
the means by which interaction or communication is achieved at an interface
a surface forming a common boundary of two bodies, spaces, or phases

dt: {bc}a set of rules that allows programmers to develop software for a particular operating system without having to be completely familiar with that operating system

dt.t: To fix this problem, trustbusters have installed a provision forcing Microsoft to disclose more information about its so-called {wi}application programming interfaces{/wi}, or APIs.

shortdef: a set of rules that allows programmers to develop software for a particular operating system without having to be completely familiar with that operating system —abbreviation API

dt: {bc}a {d_link|user interface|user interface} that allows a computer user to interact easily with the computer typically by making choices from displayed menus or groups of icons

dt.t: … how quickly the software companies can write new applications, or new versions of old applications, to take advantage of windows, icons, menus and mice, the principal elements of the {wi}graphical user interface{/wi}.

shortdef: a user interface that allows a computer user to interact easily with the computer typically by making choices from displayed menus or groups of icons

dt: {bc}software that is designed to allow a computer user to interact with the operating system of a machine or system (such as by selecting presented options or entering text commands)

dt.t: Likewise, the {wi}user interface{/wi} is remarkably unintuitive, requiring a whirlwind of relentless mouse clicking to move, talk, touch, look, or manipulate onscreen objects.
… a new {wi}user interface{/wi} he vows will change the way people use computers.

shortdef: software that is designed to allow a computer user to interact with the operating system of a machine or system (such as by selecting presented options or entering text commands); especially : graphical user interface — abbreviation UI
